summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Alice in Wonderland [DVD]
Review Date: 2014/11/26
Store: Allington, Mark  (Actor),     Bennett, Alan  (Actor)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Fantasy
Product Description: ['Amazon.com', "Fans of Lewis Carroll's classic novel for children will be fascinated by this startling 1966 interpretation by Jonathan Miller, a noted British theater director. Influenced by surrealism and Victorian architecture, Miller's black-and-white version of Wonderland is a dour and creepy place, not the frenetic and charming bustle usually depicted. A brunette Alice (Anne-Marie Mallik) wanders like a sleepwalker, rarely looking anyone in the eye, and has fractured conversations with the likes of the Mad Hatter (Peter Cook,", 'Bedazzled', '), the Caterpillar (Sir Michael Redgrave,', 'The Lady Vanishes', '), the Duchess (Leo McKern,', 'Rumpole of the Bailey', '), and the Mock Turtle (Sir John Gielgud,', 'Brideshead Revisited', ',', 'Arthur', "). The result is probably an accurate picture of the adult world seen through a child's eyes--an unsettling and intriguing vision. Also featuring Peter Sellers as the King of Hearts and music by Ravi Shankar.", '--Bret Fetzer']
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Format': 'DVD, NTSC, Live, Black & White', 'Contributor': 'Maxwell Muller, Jo, Gostelow, Gordon, Dunn, Geoffrey, Bird, John, Bennett, Alan, Elgar, Avril, Jebb, Julian, Lawson, Wilfrid, Mallik, Anne-Marie, Cook, Peter, Currie, Finlay, Evans, Nicholas, Redgrave, Michael, Brambell, Wilfrid, Gough, Michael, Dowie, Freda, Allington, Mark, McKern, Leo, Trent, AnthonyMaxwell Muller, Jo, Gostelow, Gordon, Dunn, Geoffrey, Bird, John, Bennett, Alan, Elgar, Avril, Jebb, Julian, Lawson, Wilfrid, Mallik, Anne-Marie, Cook, Peter, Currie, Finlay, Evans, Nicholas, Redgrave, Michael, Brambell, Wilfrid, Gough, Michael, Dowie, Freda, Allington, Mark, McKern…   See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 12 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.1 x 5.42 x 0.58 inches; 2.93 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'DVD, NTSC, Live, Black & White', 'Run time': '1 hour and 12 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 18, 2003', 'Actors': 'Allington, Mark, Bennett, Alan, Bird, John, Brambell, Wilfrid, Cook, Peter', 'Studio': 'Homevision', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: This is more in the spirit of the book than most. And my kids loved it. And we all loath the Tim Burton version.
Review Title: And my kids loved it. And we all loath the Tim Burton ...
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Legacy  (English Subtitled)
Review Date: 2015/08/10
Categories: Suspense, International, Drama
Product Description: ["In Danish with English subtitles. What should be an easy division of a renowned artist's estate becomes complicated when her adult children arrive at her countryside manor.  The identity of one of them is revealed only upon the artist's death. As the four siblings discover the secrets and lies surrounding their childhood, they're forced to look at themselves and each other with new eyes."]
Average Rating: 4.3

Review Text: Gripping. Realistic. Unsentimental.
Review Title: Five Stars

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual's purchase history reveals a strong preference for high-quality, artistic, and thought-provoking content, primarily in the form of movies and documentaries. They consistently rate products positively, with average ratings predominantly around 4.4 to 5.0, indicating a tendency toward enjoyment and satisfaction. 

The themes predominantly include fantasy and suspense, showcasing an appreciation for stories that offer deeper narratives and emotional engagement. The presence of films that are adaptations of literary works or that delve into complex family dynamics suggests a liking for introspective and nuanced storytelling.

Quality is evidently prioritized over cost, as evidenced by the purchase of both classic and contemporary films that are critically acclaimed. This suggests that the individual is willing to invest in content that reflects artistic merit and provides rich viewing experiences, rather than seeking purely mainstream or commercial offerings. 

Overall, the core preferences highlight an affinity for cinematic works that represent unique viewpoints, emotional resonance, and compelling storytelling, paired with a discerning approach to product quality.

target_interaction.title: if you like scandi noir you will love this
target_interaction.text: Ttapped is the best TV scandi crime series of 2018. We loved it. Please Amazon, give us more of these. And with NO dubbing!!! The Legacy was the last series you had at this level and that was 2016. Before that, Borgen and of course Wallander. On other platforms The Bridge was a stand-out. But there must be many we simply don't get access to. Please grab them and ADVERTISE them so we can feed our addiction. Thanks.
description: [In Icelandic with English subtitles.] As a ferry is approaching a small Icelandic town in a deep fjord in the east, a dead body is found. Without a head, limbs and legs, this is more just a torso. Unrecognizable. No one knows who the body belongs to.
target_interaction.subtitle: UnentitledUnentitled
